      • getSubject

        public final MapItem getSubject()
        Specified by:

      • setOpaque

        public final void setOpaque(java.lang.Object opaque)
        Description copied from interface: GLMapItem2
        Sets opaque data that can be used by the renderer. Only the object that has taken ownership of rendering this GLMapItem should invoke this method.

        This method serves as a convenience to allow the render to store application specific data with an item.

        Specified by:
        setOpaque in interface GLMapItem2
        Parameters:
        opaque - An object

      • getOpaque

        public final java.lang.Object getOpaque()
        Description copied from interface: GLMapItem2
        Returns the data previously set via the call to GLMapItem2.setOpaque(Object). This method should really only be invoked by the object that set the opaque data.

        This method serves as a convenience to allow the render to obtain the application specific data that has been previously associated with an item.

        Specified by:
        getOpaque in interface GLMapItem2
        Returns:
        The previously set data.

      • startObserving

        public void startObserving()
        Description copied from interface: GLMapItem2
        Start observing the subject. This method should register callback listeners on any properties of the subject that would affect its rendered representation.

        Invoking this method should generally refresh the state of the item.

        This method may not be invoked on the GL context thread.

        Specified by:
        startObserving in interface GLMapItem2

      • stopObserving

        public void stopObserving()
        Stops observing the subject. This method should unwind any callback listeners registered via startObserving().

        This method may not be invoked on the GL context thread.

        Specified by:
        stopObserving in interface GLMapItem2

      • markSurfaceDirty

        protected final void markSurfaceDirty(boolean realtime)

      • forward

        public static void forward(GLMapView ortho,
                           GeoPoint gp,
                           PointD point,
                           double unwrap)
        Transforms the specified coordinate, applying any elevation adjustments (e.g. exaggeration/offset) that is used by the renderer. The value is returned via point.

        If gp does not have a valid altitude, or its altitude is below the terrain surface, the terrain surface value will be used.

        Parameters:
        ortho - The view
        gp - The LLA coordinate
        point - Returns the x,y,z for the coordinate
        unwrap - Longitudinal unwrap value (360, -360, or 0 to ignore)

      • forward

        public static void forward(GLMapView ortho,
                           GeoPoint gp,
                           PointD point,
                           double unwrap,
                           double terrain,
                           boolean clampSubAlt)
        Transforms the specified coordinate, applying any elevation adjustments (e.g. exaggeration/offset) that is used by the renderer. The value is returned via point.

        If gp does not have a valid altitude, or its altitude is below the terrain surface, the terrain surface value will be used.

        Parameters:
        ortho - The view
        gp - The LLA coordinate
        point - Returns the x,y,z for the coordinate
        unwrap - Longitudinal unwrap value (360, -360, or 0 to ignore)
        terrain - The local terrain value at the location
        clampSubAlt - True to clamp sub-terrain altitude to the ground

      • forward

        public static void forward(GLMapView ortho,
                           GeoPoint gp,
                           PointD point,
                           double unwrap,
                           double terrain)
